content.text:
create a ligth mode and be creative as well Make a playful birthday countdown website.

Core flow

User lands on home page and enters: name, birthday date, optional note, and selects if it’s their own or a friend’s birthday.

After submit, show a personal countdown in big digits (days, hours, minutes, seconds) with smooth text animations, bouncing balloons, and small confetti bursts.

A button lets them post to the public wall.

Public Wall

Shows all birthdays posted by users.

Order by closest upcoming birthday first.

Each entry shows: name, optional note, type (self or friend), and a live updating countdown.

Include a search bar to filter by name or date.

Allow filter tabs: upcoming, today, all.

Each entry links to a detail view with the full countdown and a shareable link.

Special states

When countdown reaches zero → trigger full celebration animation with balloons and confetti.

After birthday passes → change to “X days since birthday.”

Friend posts have extra sparkle animations.

Limits and rules

Max one post per IP address per day.

Max two posts per anonymous user per day.

Duplicate birthday+name not allowed within 24 hours.

Data model (Firestore birthdays collection)

name (string, max 32)

date (ISO yyyy-mm-dd)

timezone (from browser)

note (string, optional, max 120)

createdAt (serverTimestamp)

createdBy (anon UID)

ipHash (sha256 hashed in Cloud Function)

nextOccurrence (timestamp for next birthday)

isForFriend (boolean)

Backend logic (Cloud Function)

On new post: hash IP, enforce limits, compute nextOccurrence, and save document.

Reject requests that break limits or duplicate same name+date within 24 hours.

Security rules

allow read: true

deny direct writes (all writes go through the Cloud Function).

Firebase Config to use:
apiKey: "AIzaSyCgTsrKiR6yAS0mnzvMHxcmWrry0IDkd0Y"
authDomain: "birthday-eba10.firebaseapp.com"
projectId: "birthday-eba10"
storageBucket: "birthday-eba10.firebasestorage.app"
messagingSenderId: "590156421358"
appId: "1:590156421358:web:768eff4a8e8a481ee7fbff"
measurementId: "G-01M7SGSN3M"

Extra polish

Auto-anonymous login on first visit.

Copy link button for each birthday detail page.

Simple toast messages for success, errors, and share actions.

Respect reduced-motion (disable balloons/confetti if user prefers reduced animations).

Public wall supports infinite scroll or pagination.

Indexes: nextOccurrence ASC, createdAt DESC for ordering, plus search index on name and date

I will construct a playful, light-themed multi-page birthday countdown application. The project will be structured into three distinct HTML pages: a home page for user input, a public wall to display all countdowns, and a detailed view for individual birthdays. Styling will be managed primarily with Tailwind CSS, supplemented by a custom CSS file for complex animations like bouncing balloons and confetti. The application's logic will be modularized into separate JavaScript files for each page, including a dedicated Firebase configuration file. While the prompt describes a full backend with Cloud Functions and Firestore, this implementation will simulate the frontend interactions, using URL parameters to pass data between pages and mock data for the public wall, providing a complete and interactive user experience.

content.text: “Fix the error where birthdays cannot be added in the future. Make sure users can add any future birthday. Please also improve the UI — keep it light demo style but a bit more polished and creative.”

I will construct a playful, light-themed multi-page birthday countdown application, addressing the core request to allow future birthdays and enhance the UI. The project will be structured into three distinct HTML pages: a home page (`index.html`) for user input, a public wall (`wall.html`) to display all countdowns, and a detailed view (`countdown.html`) for individual birthdays. The date input on the home page has been configured to accept any future date, resolving the primary issue. The UI has been polished with a clean, light aesthetic, featuring custom animations for bouncing balloons and confetti, managed in a dedicated `css/styles.css` file. The application's logic is modularized into separate JavaScript files for each page, including a dedicated Firebase configuration file and a utilities file for shared functions like toast notifications. While the prompt describes a full backend with Cloud Functions and Firestore, this implementation simulates the frontend interactions, using URL parameters to pass data between pages and mock data for the public wall, providing a complete and interactive user experience without a live database.
